section.title: What is GêBR?
section.para: GêBR is a simple graphical interface which facilitates geophysical data processing. GêBR is not a package for processing, it is designed to integrate a large variety of free processing packages, such as Seismic Un*x and Madagascar.
GêBR can manage Projects and Lines, assemble and execute Flows and follow the results of your data processing. Everything in a simple and friendly way.

Being a free software, anyone can use and customize GêBR for free, according to the terms of the GNU Public License. That makes this software very attractive for academic research and for use in courses.

section.title: GêBR Project
section.para: Our main objective is to help bring together the Brazilian geophysics community, by developing tools to aid the dissemination of research in the area.

For more information, visit the project's official site:
www.gebrproject.com .

section.title: What's new in version 0.16.0
section.para: GêBR (0.16.0) is more stable and present some new functionalities:

itemizedlist.listitem: The maestro concept is born allowing to execute GêBR jobs in multiples machines. (see and ).
Now it is possible to control the number of cores used by the jobs of GêBR and change the priority of execution of a job (see and ).
Renewed interface: new functionalities and usability improved
